basics.name: Ing. Oliver Matonoha, PhD
basics.title: Postdoctoral Researcher in Particle Physics
basics.summary: Postdoctoral researcher in experimental particle physics. I did my PhD (and my first postdoc) at Lund University in Sweden and moved back to Prague in 2024. I work primarily within STAR and remain active in ALICE, with interests spanning small systems, novel observables, long-range correlations, and unfolding (including deep learning).
basics.publications: 180 citable publications, 2600+ citations, h-index 26. Main author of 8 publications. Published in journals such as Nature, Nature Physics, Physics Review Letters, European Physics Journal.

work.name: FNSPE, Czech Technical University (CTU), Prague, Czech Republic
work.summary: Postdoc funded through the CTU Global Postdoctoral Fellowship Program. Research primarily within the STAR collaboration (small systems, long-range correlations, and unfolding including deep learning techniques), with continued contributions to ALICE.

work.name: ALICE experiment, CERN, Switzerland
work.summary: Analyzing data from proton-proton collisions at the LHC, focusing on the search for strange particles and commissioning of the GEM detector technology.

work.name: ALICE experiment, CERN, Switzerland
work.summary: Communicating the needs of Swedish junior scientists to the ALICE collaboration and vice versa.

work.name: CTU, Prague / LU, Sweden
work.summary: Teaching practical classes in Physics/Particle Physics. At Lund University, also responsible for class format and preparation.

work.name: Czech Technical University (CTU), Prague, Czech Republic
work.summary: Course responsible for 'Physics of collisions of nuclei' (Master’s level) and 'Tools for simulation and data analysis' (Bachelor’s level). Supervision of a Bachelor’s student.

work.name: STAR experiment, BNL, USA
work.summary: Conducted data analysis on high-energy physics, specifically Upsilon meson production studies.

education.institution: Czech Technical University, FNSPE, Prague, Czech Republic

volunteer.summary: Annually contribute to creating summer schools for high schoolers, teaching 'AI in Particle Physics,' and serving as a school coordinator, ombudsperson, data analyst, and tutor guide.

volunteer.organization: Equal Opportunities Committee at LU, Sweden
volunteer.summary: Represented PhDs on the departmental committee, focusing on promoting equal opportunities, gender equality, and counteracting discrimination.
Mentored high schoolers annually on personal and academic development.
